metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000517 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
BusyBox project BusyBox wget version prior to commit 8e2174e9bd836e53c8b9c6e00d1bc6e2a718686e contains a Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Busybox wget that can result in heap buffer overflow. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in after commit 8e2174e9bd836e53c8b9c6e00d1bc6e2a718686e.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000517` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
busybox-static - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
udhcpc - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
udhcpd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2').
